newsitem.title: MAURITIUS: Banks and hotels push up Mauritius bourse index.
newsitem.headline: Banks and hotels push up Mauritius bourse index.

text.p: Shares in the State Bank of Mauritius (SBM) and New Mauritius Hotels (NMH) pushed the Mauritius stock exchange index higher on Friday, bourse officials said.
The Semdex index gained 3.13 points to 371.89.
Transaction volume of 7.37 million rupees on 328,621 shares compared to 6.05 million rupees on 195,326 shares on Wednesday.

SBM closed 50 cents higher at 12.20 rupees on 4,700 shares. Mauritius Commercial Bank was stable at 85.00 rupees with 8,670 shares traded. Swan Insurance gained 70 cents to 43.00 rupees on 1,650 shares.
In the hotel sector NMH rose 60 cents to 36.00 rupees on 109,100 shares. Grand Baie Hotel was unchanged at 46.20 rupees on 359 shares and Sun Resorts stayed level at 44.70 rupees on 2,064 shares.
"The main factor behind price increases pushing the index higher is the sound figures and growth potential (which) showed in companies' final accounts audited reports," one broker said.
National carrier Air Mauritius fell by 1.40 rupees to 41.00 rupees on 918 shares traded, stopping a slow and gentle rise.
In the commerce sector conglomerate Ireland Blyth was stable at 14.50 rupees on 3,647 shares. Rogers was unchanged at 100.00 rupees on 2,767 shares traded.
In the investment sector Policy gained 20 cents to 4.50 rupees on 127,900 shares and Promotion And Development (PAD) remained at 15.00 rupees on 1,000 shares.
